blocks.content_html:
Navigation

Unreal Engine C++ API Reference > Plugins > GLTFExporter > Options

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • UObject
  • UGLTFExportOptions

References

   
Module GLTFExporter
Header /Engine/Plugins/Enterprise/GLTFExporter/Source/GLTFExporter/Public/Options/GLTFExportOptions.h
Include #include "Options/GLTFExportOptions.h"

Syntax

UCLASS (BlueprintType, Config=EditorPerProjectUserSettings, HideCategories=(DebugProperty))  
class UGLTFExportOptions : public UObject

Variables

  Type Name Description
bool bAdjustNormalmaps If enabled, exported normalmaps will be adjusted from Unreal to glTF convention (i.e. the green channel is flipped).
EGLTFMaterialBakeMode BakeMaterialInputs Bake mode determining if and how a material input is baked out to a texture.
bool bExportAnimationSequences If enabled, export single animation asset used by a skeletal mesh component.
bool bExportCameras If enabled, export camera components.
bool bExportClearCoatMaterials If enabled, materials with shading model clear coat will be properly exported.
bool bExportClothMaterials If enabled, materials with shading model cloth will be properly exported.
bool bExportEmissiveStrength If enabled, allows materials to have an emissive factor that exceeds the standard range [0.0, 1.0].
bool bExportHiddenInGame If enabled, export actors and components that are flagged as hidden in-game.
bool bExportLevelSequences If enabled, export level sequences.
bool bExportLights If enabled, export directional, point, and spot light components.
bool bExportPreviewMesh If enabled, the preview mesh for a standalone animation or material asset will also be exported.
bool bExportProxyMaterials If enabled, materials that have a proxy defined in their user data, will be exported using that proxy instead.
bool bExportSourceModel If enabled, exports the SourceModel. If false, exports the Render Data.
bool bExportSpecularGlossinessMaterials If enabled, materials using the Importer's SpecularGlossiness material function will be exported.
bool bExportTextureTransforms If enabled, export UV offset and scale/tiling used in materials.
bool bExportThinTranslucentMaterials If enabled, materials with shading model thin translucency will be exported.
bool bExportUnlitMaterials If enabled, materials with shading model unlit will be properly exported.
bool bExportVertexColors If enabled, export vertex color.
bool bExportVertexSkinWeights If enabled, export vertex bone weights and indices in skeletal meshes.
bool bIncludeCopyrightNotice If enabled, the copyright notice from project settings will be included as metadata in the glTF asset.
bool bMakeSkinnedMeshesRoot If enabled, make skeletal meshes into root nodes to strictly comply with the glTF specification.
bool bSkipNearDefaultValues If enabled, floating-point-based JSON properties that are nearly equal to their default value will not be exported and thus regarded as exactly default, reducing JSON size.
bool bUseImporterMaterialMapping If enabled, materials imported with the Interchange-glTF importer will be directly mapped for the Exporter.
bool bUseMeshQuantization If enabled, use quantization for vertex tangents and normals, reducing size.
TMap< EGLTFMaterialPropertyGroup, FGLTFOverrideMaterialBakeSettings > DefaultInputBakeSettings Input-specific default bake settings that override the general defaults above.
int32 DefaultLevelOfDetail Default LOD level used for exporting a mesh.
TEnumAsByte< TextureFilter > DefaultMaterialBakeFilter Default filtering mode used when sampling the baked out texture.
FGLTFMaterialBakeSize DefaultMaterialBakeSize Default size of the baked out texture (containing the material input).
TEnumAsByte< TextureAddress > DefaultMaterialBakeTiling Default addressing mode used when sampling the baked out texture.
EGLTFMaterialVariantMode ExportMaterialVariants Mode determining if and how to export material variants that change the materials property on a static or skeletal mesh component.
float ExportUniformScale Scale factor used for exporting all assets (0.01 by default) for conversion from centimeters (Unreal default) to meters (glTF).
EGLTFTextureImageFormat TextureImageFormat Desired image format used for exported textures.
int32 TextureImageQuality Level of compression used for textures exported with lossy image formats, 0 (default) or value between 1 (worst quality, best compression) and 100 (best quality, worst compression).

Constructors

  Type Name Description
 

UGLTFExportOptions ( const FObjectInitializer& ObjectInitializer
)

  

Functions

ResetToDefault ()
